Docs.summary: Represents a list control that encapsulates a group of radio button controls.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Specifying List Layout](#specifying_list_layout) - [Accessibility](#accessibility) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction The control provides page developers with a single-selection radio button group that can be dynamically generated through data binding. It contains an collection with members that correspond to individual items on the list. To determine which item is selected, test the property of the list. ## Specifying List Layout You can specify how the list is rendered by setting the and properties. For information about layout options, see the enumeration. By default, is set to `RepeatDirection.Vertical`. Setting this property to `RepeatDirection.Horizontal` causes the control to render the list horizontally. Some settings do not allow horizontal layout. For more information, see the enumeration. > [!CAUTION] > This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script. Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application. You can use validation controls to verify user input before displaying the input text in a control. ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input. For more information, see [Securing Standard Controls](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f3e7718f-63d0-44a3-bd5f-48cc2059c2a8), [How to: Protect Against Script Exploits in a Web Application by Applying HTML Encoding to Strings](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/6f67973f-dda0-45a1-ba9d-e88532d7dc5b), and [Validating User Input in ASP.NET Web Pages](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4ad3dacb-89e0-4cee-89ac-40a3f2a85461). ## Accessibility For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7e3ce9c4-6b7d-4fb1-94b5-72cf2a44fe13) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/847a37e3-ce20-41da-b0d3-7dfb0fdae9a0). ## Declarative Syntax ```              ``` ## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically modify the display of a control. > [!NOTE] > The following code example uses the single-file code model and might not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code example must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417). [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic RadioButtonList Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButtonList Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic RadioButtonList Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButtonList Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the distance (in pixels) between the border and the contents of the table cell.
Docs.value: The distance (in pixels) between the border and the contents of the table cell. The default is -1, which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property applies only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to `RepeatLayout.Table`.
Use this property to control the spacing between the contents of a cell and the cell's border.
The padding amount specified is added to all four sides of a cell. It uses the height of the tallest cell in the table and the width of the widest cell in the table. The resulting cell size is applied uniformly to all cells in the table. Individual cell sizes cannot be specified.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.CellPadding%2A> property to pad the cells of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control with 10 pixels.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic RadioButtonList.CellPadding Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButtonList.CellPadding Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic RadioButtonList.CellPadding Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButtonList.CellPadding Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls

Docs.value: The distance (in pixels) between adjacent table cells. The default is -1, which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property applies only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to `RepeatLayout.Table`.
Use this property to control the spacing between individual cells in the table. This property is applied both vertically and horizontally.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.CellSpacing%2A> property to space the cells of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control apart by 10 pixels.

Docs.param: The key identifier for the control, used to index the .
A that contains value information indexed by control identifiers.
Docs.summary: Processes the posted data for the control.
Docs.returns: if the state of the is different from the last posting; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.LoadPostData%2A> method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.LoadPostData%2A> method indicates whether the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control has changed. In other words, it determines whether the selected list item in the control is the same as the last posted value. A user changing the selected item in the control changes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndex%2A> value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control. If the same list item is selected in the control, or if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control is disabled, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.LoadPostData%2A> returns `false`.
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.LoadPostData%2A> method returns `true` for a control, the ASP.NET page framework invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method for the control.

Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void RaisePostDataChangedEvent ();

Protected Overridable Sub RaisePostDataChangedEvent ()
protected: virtual void RaisePostDataChangedEvent();
abstract member RaisePostDataChangedEvent : unit -> unit override this.RaisePostDataChangedEvent : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Notifies the ASP.NET application that the state of the control has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
The ASP.NET page framework calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.LoadPostData%2A> method indicates that the state of the list items have changed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method to raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event. Control developers can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method to perform custom processing when the user changes the selected item in the control.
The `RaisePostBackEvent` method can optionally perform validation before raising the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event for the control. To validate a group of controls on the page when a list item within the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control is selected, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.AutoPostBack%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.CausesValidation%2A> properties to `true`, and then specify the group of controls to be validated in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.ValidationGroup%2A> property.

Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls

Docs.param: A that contains the output stream for rendering on the client.
Docs.summary: Displays the control on the client.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.Render%2A> method implementation for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo> object for the list, and calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RenderRepeater%2A> method, which in turn uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RenderItem%2A> method to render individual radio button list items.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.Render%2A> method in a custom server control so that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control is always displayed with descriptive text.
[!code-aspx-csharp[CustomRadioButtonListRender#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CustomRadioButtonListRender/CS/custom_radiobuttonlist_rendercs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[CustomRadioButtonListRender#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CustomRadioButtonListRender/VB/custom_radiobuttonlist_rendervb.aspx#1)] [!code-csharp[CustomRadioButtonListRender#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CustomRadioButtonListRender/CS/custom_radiobuttonlist_render.cs#2)] [!code-vb[CustomRadioButtonListRender#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CustomRadioButtonListRender/VB/custom_radiobuttonlist_render.vb#2)]

Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls

Docs.summary: Renders a list item in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.Render%2A> method implementation for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo> object for the list, and calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RenderRepeater%2A> method, which in turn uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RenderItem%2A> method to render individual radio-button list items.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RenderItem%2A> method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control ignores the `itemType` and `repeatInfo` parameters. The `repeatIndex` parameter value is used to select the radio button list item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection, and the selected list item is rendered to the output stream.

Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns to display in the control.
Docs.value: The number of columns to display in the . The default is 0, which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.Table>, you can use this property to specify the number of columns that display items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control. If this property is not set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control displays all items in the list in a single column.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns%2A> property to display the items of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control in two columns.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.exception: The number of columns is set to a negative value.
Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection RepeatDirection { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection RepeatDirection
Public Overridable Property RepeatDirection As RepeatDirection

public: virtual property System::Web::UI::WebControls::RepeatDirection RepeatDirection { System::Web::UI::WebControls::RepeatDirection get(); void set(System::Web::UI::WebControls::RepeatDirection value); };
member this.RepeatDirection : System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the direction in which the radio buttons within the group are displayed.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to specify the display direction of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.
> [!NOTE] > The number of columns that are displayed is always determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns%2A> property.
If this property is set to `RepeatDirection.Vertical` and if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.Table>, the first column is filled from top to bottom, then the next column, and so on until all items are rendered. For example, if <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns%2A> is set to 3, the items of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control are displayed in three columns. A nine-item list would appear as follows.
|||| |-|-|-| |1|4|7| |2|5|8| |3|6|9|
If this property is set to `RepeatDirection.Horizontal` and if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.Table>, the items in the list are displayed in rows loaded left to right, then top to bottom, until all items are rendered. For example, if <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns%2A> is set to 3, the items of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control are displayed in rows of three items. A nine-item list would appear as follows.
|||| |-|-|-| |1|2|3| |4|5|6| |7|8|9|
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatDirection%2A> property to display the items of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control in columns filled top to bottom, and then left to right.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic RadioButtonList.RepeatDirection Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButtonList.RepeatDirection Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic RadioButtonList.RepeatDirection Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButtonList.RepeatDirection Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.exception: The display direction of the list is not one of the values.
Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls

Protected Overridable ReadOnly Property RepeatedItemCount As Integer
protected: virtual property int RepeatedItemCount { int get(); };
member this.RepeatedItemCount : int

Docs.summary: Gets the number of list items in the control.
Docs.value: The number of items in the list control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatedItemCount%2A> property is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
If there are no items set in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatedItemCount%2A> property is zero. If there are items set in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatedItemCount%2A> property is the same as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.Count%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection.

Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls

Docs.value: A value that specifies whether the list will be rendered by using a element, a element, an element, or a element. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For information about the available options, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> enumeration.
> [!NOTE] > Two options are new as of ASP.NET 4: <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.OrderedList> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.UnorderedList>.
Some <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> settings do not allow horizontal layout. For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> enumeration.

member this.TextAlign : System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextAlign with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text alignment for the radio buttons within the group.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to specify whether the text associated with the radio buttons appears on the left or right. If this property is set to `TextAlign.Right`, the text is displayed to the right of the radio button. If this property is set to `TextAlign.Left`, the text is displayed to the left of the radio button.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.TextAlign%2A> property to display the text associated with the radio buttons on the left side of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic RadioButtonList.TextAlign Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButtonList.TextAlign Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)]

Docs.exception: The label text alignment associated with the radio buttons is not one of the values.
Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls
